title: Cox's Bazar Sea Beach
description: Cox's Bazar is known for having the world's longest natural sea beach, stretching for 120 kilometers along the Bay of Bengal.

title: Sundarbans Mangrove Forest
description: The Sundarbans is the largest mangrove forest in the world and home to the Bengal tiger. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

title: Sajek Valley Hill Resort
description: Sajek Valley is a picturesque hill resort in the Chittagong Hill Tracts, offering stunning views and a tranquil atmosphere.

title: Srimangal Tea Gardens
description: Srimangal is known as the 'Tea Capital of Bangladesh' and is famous for its lush tea gardens and serene surroundings.

title: Ratnodweep Island
description: Ratnodweep is a small island in the Bay of Bengal, known for its crystal-clear waters and coral reefs, making it a great spot for snorkeling and diving.

title: Kuakata Sea Beach
description: Kuakata is known as the 'Daughter of the Sea' and offers a panoramic view of both the sunrise and sunset over the Bay of Bengal.

title: Rangamati Hill District
description: Rangamati is a picturesque hill district surrounded by lush green hills, rivers, and lakes, making it a popular destination for nature lovers.

title: Saint Martin's Island
description: Saint Martin's Island is the only coral island in Bangladesh and is known for its stunning beaches, clear waters, and diverse marine life.

title: Jaflong Tea Gardens
description: Jaflong is a scenic spot in the Sylhet region, famous for its tea gardens, Khasi tribal culture, and views of the Khasi hills.

title: Paharpur Buddhist Vihara
description: Paharpur is home to an ancient Buddhist Vihara dating back to the 8th century and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
